transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi? This is Arjun from MongoDB, hope I’m not catching you at a bad time.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, speaking. I have a few minutes—what’s up?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great. I saw Acme Corp. recently rolled out some new AI features and you’re running on-prem MongoDB. I wanted to see if you’ve looked at Atlas for your next phase.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’re aware of Atlas, but honestly, we’re hesitant to move off-prem given, you know, the compliance and latency issues with cloud.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally get it. Security and compliance come up a lot, especially in gaming. Atlas has SOC2, ISO, and regional controls. Would it help if we did a deep-dive with your compliance team?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: I mean, maybe, but part of the issue is our own internal policies. Our users are super privacy-focused—some data can’t leave our servers, period.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Understood. There are hybrid options, but sounds like strict on-prem is a must. Is data modeling for new AI stuff another concern?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, honestly, lifting and shifting that workload just isn’t, uh, realistic for us right now. Too much rework and risk.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That makes sense. It’s just—Atlas can, you know, handle scaling for unpredictable loads. I get compliance is non-negotiable, but are you totally closed to cloud even for secondary workloads?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, Arjun, I just don’t see us moving anything critical or AI-related off-prem in the near future. It’d take a huge policy change internally.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Got it. I appreciate the candor, Zhi. If things shift later, can I check in again in a few months?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, but honestly, don’t expect movement. We’re committed to on-prem for now.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Understood. Thanks for your time, Zhi. Have a good one.
